title: Username and sim id enum

profile.name: Mobile Vikings
profile.about: Mobile Vikings is a prepaid provider that lets you connect to your Viking friends for free!

vulnerability_information:
Look at this url (GET request)
https://mobilevikings.be/en/sims/authorization/remove/admin/1036358/ - looks good - admin user detected 
https://mobilevikings.be/en/sims/authorization/remove/lloyd/1036358/ - looks good - lloyd user detected
https://mobilevikings.be/en/sims/authorization/remove/lloydxxx/1036358/ - there is no lloydxxx user
Sim card id (exist username should be used - lloyd in this case):
https://mobilevikings.be/en/sims/authorization/remove/lloyd/1036358/ - sim card id 1036358 detected
https://mobilevikings.be/en/sims/authorization/remove/lloyd/1036359/ - sim card id 1036359 detected
https://mobilevikings.be/en/sims/authorization/remove/lloyd/1036351/ - there is no sim card id 1036351
vulnerability_information_html:
Look at this url (GET request)
https://mobilevikings.be/en/sims/authorization/remove/admin/1036358/ - looks good - admin user detected
https://mobilevikings.be/en/sims/authorization/remove/lloyd/1036358/ - looks good - lloyd user detected
https://mobilevikings.be/en/sims/authorization/remove/lloydxxx/1036358/ - there is no lloydxxx user
Sim card id (exist username should be used - lloyd in this case):
https://mobilevikings.be/en/sims/authorization/remove/lloyd/1036358/ - sim card id 1036358 detected
https://mobilevikings.be/en/sims/authorization/remove/lloyd/1036359/ - sim card id 1036359 detected
https://mobilevikings.be/en/sims/authorization/remove/lloyd/1036351/ - there is no sim card id 1036351

activities.message:
Hi 4lemon,

Thanks for your submission! If I get this right, you can check wether a user exists and whether a specific SIM card id is linked to it. 
I believe we can check whether an username exists (is already taken) upon the registration process. I'm also not too sure whether we consider the sim card ID as specific information - it's just an identifier. Could you maybe provide some more information on this one? Can you, for example, link the SIM id to a telephone number (I would consider that to be an issue), or do you see any further security implications in the username disclosure?

Thanks

Inti

activities.message:
"Can you, for example, link the SIM id to a telephone number" -> https://hackerone.com/reports/47362
May this is not a security issue. And to be honest in this url not checked if username and sim id really got this auth or not. I think about this issue.

activities.message:
Looking at your other reports as we speak :-)

Will close this one for now due to lack of security implications. Feel free let me know if you do not agree.
Thanks anyways! Will look at your other submissions now.

Viking greetings, 

Inti
